column4: Alexion to buy Enobia Pharma
column5: Biopharmaceutical company Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc  agreed to buy Enobia Pharma Corp in an all-cash deal to gain access to the privately owned firm's key therapy for treating a rare and fatal metabolic bone disease.

column4: Netflix  Gap lag in customer satisfaction online
column5: Netflix Inc and Gap Inc were among the worst performers in customer satisfaction among the largest online retailers this holiday season  according to a survey released on Wednesday. | Video

column4: TEXT-S&P puts Sears on negative watch
column5: -- Hoffman Estates  Ill.-based Sears Holding Corp. announced that EBITDA will be less than half of its prior year's amount.

column4: Sears closing up to 120 stores as sales slide
column5: Sears Holdings Corp  will close as many as 120 of its Kmart and Sears discount and department stores after its holiday sales slumped  sending its shares sliding more than 27 percent to their lowest level in three years. | Video

column4: Court OKs AIG's $450 million workers comp settlement
column5: A federal judge has approved American International Group Inc's  $450 million settlement with rival insurers to end litigation accusing AIG of underreporting premiums on workers' compensation policies.

column2: Bank Of New York Mellon Corporation (The)
column4: Whistleblower documents illuminate case against BNY Mellon
column5: NEW YORK Confidential whistleblower documents that helped spark a massive state and federal investigation into how Bank of New York Mellon Corp charged pension funds for currency exchange  provide a rare window into how a bank insider aided a lawsuit against the bank.

column4: UPDATE 1-RuggedCom adopts poison pill in wake of Belden bid
column5: Dec 28 Canada's RuggedCom Inc  said it adopted a shareholder rights plan in response to U.S. cable manufacturer Belden Inc's C$280 million unsolicited bid.

column4: For the not-so-serious drinker: Marshmallow vodka
column5: NEW YORK Vodkas flavored with citrus and berry have been around for years and recently some newer brands have been trying to create buzz with unusual flavors. But this holiday season  for the first time  the world's largest vodka brand is trying to appeal to Americans' sweet tooth with zany flavors like "fluffed marshmallow" and "whipped cream."

column4: NY Times to sell regional newspapers for $143 million
column5: The New York Times Co said it will sell 16 regional newspapers spread across the U.S. Southeast and California to Halifax Media Holdings for $143 million in cash as it looks to cut costs and focus on its most important papers and their websites.
